performance_progress: Noah is a kind, cooperative student who enjoys hands-on learning and routine. He reads and completes math tasks significantly below grade level and requires direct teaching, repetition, and visual supports. Noah benefits from small-group instruction and clear, concrete language.

education_goals.academic: By June 2026, Noah will accurately solve addition, subtraction, and multiplication questions with numbers to 100 using visual supports with at least 80% accuracy in 4 out of 5 trials.
education_goals.social: Noah will initiate or respond to greetings and simple conversations with peers in 4 out of 5 observed opportunities.
education_goals.behavioural: Noah will follow classroom routines (entry, transitions, packing up) with no more than one prompt in 4 out of 5 days.
education_goals.communicative: Noah will express preferences and ask simple questions using complete sentences in structured activities.

accommodations.instructional:
Use concrete materials and visuals.
Provide repeated practice and immediate feedback.
Modify reading and math tasks to functional levels.
accommodations.environmental:
Preferential seating near teacher.
Access to small-group support.
accommodations.assessment:
Use simplified language and reduced items.
Allow oral responses.
Track progress through observation checklists.
accommodations.technology:
Use of tablet for interactive math and reading apps.
Visual schedule tools.

assessments: Psychological assessment (Mar 2023) indicates mild intellectual disability with strength in social relatedness and routine-based tasks.
transition_goals:
Short-term: increase independence with daily routines.
Long-term: develop functional academic and life skills to support community participation.
